Here are a few tips to help you manage your time:

### Be mindful of your time:
Be mindful of how you spend your time and make conscious decisions about how you use it.
Take stock of how you spend your day and identify areas where you could improve your time management skills.

### Set priorities:
Prioritize your tasks and activities based on their importance and urgency. This will help you to focus on the most important tasks first and avoid getting distracted by less important tasks.
Make a list of your top priorities for the day and focus on those first.

### Create a schedule:
Create a schedule that includes the tasks you want to accomplish each day. This will help you to stay organized and focused on the tasks that are most important to you.
Be flexible with your schedule and allow for some flexibility in case unexpected things come up that require your attention.

### Manage interruptions:
Manage interruptions by setting boundaries around your time and by letting people know when you're busy or unavailable.
Use tools like email filters, social media settings, or Do Not Disturb mode to help reduce distractions.

### Use time tracking tools:
Use time tracking tools like timers, stopwatches, or apps to track how you spend your time. This can help you identify areas where you can improve your productivity and focus on your most important tasks.
Consider investing in a good productivity app like Todoist, Trello, or Asana to help you manage projects and keep track of all the things you need to do.

### Don't be afraid to say no:
Learn to say no when asked to take on more work or tasks that aren't part of your job description. This will help you focus on what's important to you and avoid feeling overwhelmed by too much work.

### Learn to multitask effectively:
Learn how to multitask effectively by prioritizing tasks and focusing on one thing at a time. Try working on one task at a time until it's completed before moving on to the next task.

### Take breaks:
Take breaks throughout the day to recharge and refocus on your goals and priorities. Use this time to relax, stretch, meditate, or do something that makes you happy.

### Review regularly:
Review your schedule regularly to make sure it's still meeting your needs and goals. Adjust as needed so that you have enough time for everything that matters most to you.
Make sure not to overbook yourself or take on too many commitments that may cause stress or overwhelm.

### Relax:
Relaxation is essential for maintaining good health and well-being, so don't forget to take some time for yourself every day! Spend some time doing things that make you happy and relaxes your mind and body, such as reading, listening to music, exercising, or meditating. This will help keep stress levels low and improve your productivity throughout the day!

Electric motors convert electrical energy into mechanical energy.

Wind turbines convert wind energy into mechanical energy.

Solar panels convert sunlight into electricity.

Tidal energy converts tidal movement into electricity.

Hydroelectric dams convert falling water into electricity.

Thermal energy is the conversion of heat to mechanical or electrical energy. 

The difference between thermal and mechanical energy is that mechanical energy can be converted to electrical energy with the help of generators while thermal energy cannot be converted directly to electrical energy.
source: गैसोलीन के विभिन्न ऑक्टेन मान का अर्थ क्या होता है?

Other colors of light, such as red and orange, are scattered more than blue light, which is why the sky appears blue to us. However, this is not the only factor that affects how the sky looks: other factors such as the amount of water vapor in the air and the relative humidity also affect how light is scattered and how colors are perceived by our eyes.
source: "आसमान किस रंग का है?"

TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) - HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol), SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol), FTP (File Transfer Protocol), IRC (Internet Relay Chat), etc.

IP (Internet Protocol) - IP is a protocol for sending information over the Internet and is used by all devices connected to the Internet. It defines how information is formatted, routed, and delivered over the Internet.

PRPL (Protocol for Relaying Information in a Routing Protocol) - PRPL is a protocol used in routing protocols to relay information between routers. It helps to reduce the number of routing table updates and prevents routing loops.

STTPL (STree Transit Time Propagation Loop) - STTPL is a loop detection mechanism used in routing protocols to detect routing loops. It uses tree transit time to detect loops and help prevent routing loops.

STPLP (Single Transit Time Loop Prevention) - STPLP is a loop prevention mechanism used in routing protocols to prevent routing loops. It uses tree transit time to detect loops and prevents routing loops by disabling the loop before it occurs.

"TCP/IP" refers to a set of protocols that enable communication on the Internet and on networks that use TCP or IP. The TCP/IP protocol suite includes protocols for transmitting data across a network, such as TCP, IP, ICMP, and UDP. The protocols provide a standard way for different devices to communicate with each other, regardless of their hardware or software configurations.

There are several ways to ensure that the content your children are watching is appropriate and educational:

1. Use parental controls on your devices: You can use parental controls on your devices to restrict access to inappropriate content and limit the amount of time your children spend on Youtube.

2. Monitor what your children are watching: Make sure that you know what your children are watching and whether or not they are being exposed to age-appropriate content.

3. Talk to your children about what they are watching: Talk to your children about what they are watching and why it might be appropriate or inappropriate for them. Encourage them to ask questions and discuss the topics in the videos with you.

5. Monitor the time spent watching Youtube: Set limits on the amount of time your children spend watching Youtube, especially if they are younger or if you have concerns about the appropriateness of the content they are viewing.

6. Encourage healthy screen time habits: Encourage your children to engage in other activities, such as playing outside or reading books, rather than spending excessive amounts of time on screens, including computers, tablets, and smartphones.

prompt: ### Human: "क्या भारत में ऑनलाइन कैसीनो कानूनी है?"### Assistant:
system:
क्या भारत में ऑनलाइन कैसीनो कानूनी है? अब यदि क्यों है, जिस पर्व के अर्थों में, 'online courses' में 'online education' त्योहर है, इस्तेर उर्ची क्रीडेटर्र में 'online learning' है.

Online courses are a kind of online education that provides a flexible and convenient way to learn. Students can access the course materials and lessons from anywhere, and they can work at their own pace. Online learning is a growing trend in education, as it allows students to learn from experts in their fields and gain practical experience through real-world projects and assignments.

Many people choose online courses for a variety of reasons, including flexibility, convenience, and cost savings. Some people prefer online learning because it allows them to study at their own pace and on their own time. Others find it more convenient than traditional classroom-based learning because they don't have to commute to school or attend classes at specific times. Online courses can also be a more affordable option than traditional education, as students can often access them for free or at a lower cost than on-campus programs.

However, there are also some potential drawbacks to online courses. Some people find it difficult to work independently and may struggle with self-discipline. Others may prefer face-to-face interaction with teachers and classmates, or may miss the social aspect of traditional education. Additionally, some employers may have concerns about the validity of online degrees or certifications, so it's important to research your program carefully before choosing it.

Overall, online courses offer many benefits for students who are willing to take advantage of the flexibility and convenience they offer. But it's important to understand the potential drawbacks before deciding whether an online course is right for you.
source: "क्या भारत में ऑनलाइन कैसीनो कानूनी है?"

ADT stands for Address Detection and Translation, which is a function that translates the address of an incoming call to the correct phone number. DET stands for Direct Exchange Trunk, which is a type of phone service that allows businesses to make and receive calls directly without using a traditional PBX system.

ADTs and DETs are both used for routing incoming calls to the correct location. ADTs typically have more advanced features than DETs, such as call screening and call routing.

ADTs are often used in large businesses with multiple locations or with complex phone systems, while DETs are more commonly found in smaller businesses that don't have the need for advanced routing features.

Ultimately, it depends on the needs of your business and your budget to determine which type of phone service is best suited for you.

1. Data:
	Data is the raw information collected from external sources, such as customers, partners, and third-party services.
	It contains the information that you want to use in your analysis and business decisions.
	For example, if you are a marketing agency, your data could include customer interactions, social media engagement, and sales data.
	
2. Information:
	Information is the processed version of raw data. It contains insights that help you make informed decisions.
	For example, if you are a marketing agency, your information could include customer interactions patterns and predictive analytics models.
	
3. Knowledge:
	Knowledge is the actionable insights from analyzing data and information. It helps you make better decisions for your business and customers.
	For example, if you are a marketing agency, your knowledge could include strategies to improve customer experience or optimize social media campaigns.
	
4. Wisdom:
	Wisdom is the application of knowledge to make better decisions for your business and customers. It's the result of making decisions based on knowledge and experience.
	For example, if you are a marketing agency, your wisdom could include a list of effective strategies or tactics to improve customer experience or optimize social media campaigns.
	
5. Truth:
	Truth is the end result of combining knowledge with wisdom to make better decisions for your business and customers. It's the outcome of making decisions based on knowledge, experience, and wisdom.
	
6. Intelligence:
	Intelligence is the ability to understand complex information and make good decisions based on it. It's the combination of data, information, knowledge, wisdom, and truth into actionable insights that help you make better business decisions for your company or clients.

3. HRH (Human Resources for Health) - "Human resources for health" (HRH) is the term used to describe the health workforce needed to achieve universal health coverage. The WHO Global Strategy on Human Resources for Health defines the HRH as the individuals working in the health sector, in both public and private sectors, including those involved in policy development and management, and those in support services such as transport, security, maintenance and logistics.
4. HRH is essential to achieve universal health coverage, which is a state of health that ensures access to quality health services for all people, regardless of their economic or social conditions. Access to adequate numbers and good quality of human resources is essential to achieve universal health coverage as these professionals play a vital role in providing quality care and helping address the factors that drive ill-health in communities.
5. This includes doctors, nurses, midwives, allied health professionals such as pharmacists, dentists, and laboratory technicians; management and support staff such as administrators, managers, supervisors, technical assistants, and logistics workers; community health workers who deliver essential services in local communities; and more recently other cadres such as paramedics and traditional healers who provide care for specific conditions.
6. Lack of human resources for health contributes to poor outcomes in the health system. These include low access to care, poor quality of care due to inadequate staffing levels or poorly trained staff; limited access to medications or diagnostic services; longer waiting times for care; and delays in addressing emergencies. All these factors can contribute to inequity in health outcomes and may also lead to poor economic productivity due to high rates of sickness absence among health workers.
7. The World Health Organization estimates that an additional one million health workers are needed globally by 2030 to meet the needs of people living in rural areas or remote locations with low density populations. The WHO Global Strategy on Human Resources for Health sets out a vision for human resources for health where countries have enough skilled human resources for all levels of care; everyone has access to quality care when they need it; health systems are resilient; and the workforce is well trained, supported, managed, rewarded and motivated.

Kutch to Gujarat State road map यूर्स (Yuvaraj Yojna) kisne banaya hai?

Yuvaraj Yojana (Kutch to Gujarat State road map) is a scheme of the Government of Gujarat. The Yuvaraj Yojana was launched in 2014-15 with the aim to provide employment opportunities for the youth of Kutch district. The scheme provides employment opportunities to youth in the field of construction of roads and bridges. Under the scheme, youth are given training and technical skills for construction work and are provided employment in various government projects. 1. **Graphene**: Graphene is a sheet of carbon atoms arranged in a honeycomb lattice. It is a single layer of carbon atoms with each carbon atom arranged in a hexagonal honeycomb lattice. This material has unique electrical, thermal, and mechanical properties that make it useful in a variety of applications, such as electronics, energy storage, and sensors.

2. **Carbon Nanotubes**: Carbon nanotubes are cylindrical tubes of carbon atoms that are extremely strong and conductive. They can be used in applications such as electronics, energy storage, and structural composites.

3. **Fullerenes**: Fullerenes are spheres or ellipsoids made up of carbon atoms arranged in a hexagonal pattern. They have unique optical properties that make them useful for solar cells and other photonic devices.

4. **Diamond**: Diamond is the hardest natural material known to man, with a hardness of 10 on the Mohs scale. It is used in applications such as cutting tools and abrasives because it is extremely durable and does not wear down easily.

5. **Buckminsterfullerene**: Buckminsterfullerene, also known as buckyballs or buckybeams, is a spherical molecule made up of 60 carbon atoms arranged in a hexagonal pattern. It is one of the most stable molecules known and has been used in research on superconductivity and quantum computing.

6. **Carbon nanospheres**: Carbon nanospheres are spherical structures made up of carbon atoms arranged in a hexagonal pattern. They have unique optical properties that make them useful in applications such as solar cells and photonic devices.

7. **Carbides**: Carbides are compounds made up of carbon and one or more other elements, such as silicon or boron. They can be used in applications such as abrasives, cutting tools, and wear-resistant coatings.

8. **Carbon black**: Carbon black is a powdery form of carbon that is produced by the incomplete combustion of petroleum products or other organic materials. It is used in applications such as tires, rubber products, and paint pigments because it gives these products their black color and improves their mechanical properties.

6. **Turn off the machine and unplug it from the outlet.** Make sure that the machine is unplugged from the outlet before cleaning or making repairs to avoid electric shock.
7. **Clean according to manufacturer's instructions.** Follow the manufacturer's instructions for cleaning and maintenance of your device.
8. **Do not use a wet cloth.** Never use a wet cloth or any other object that could conduct electricity to clean your device, as this can be dangerous and may damage your device.
9. **Seek help from a professional.** If you are unsure about repairing your device yourself, seek help from a professional electrician or appliance repair technician to ensure your safety and avoid further damage to your device or your home.
10. **Have your device inspected by a professional.** If you have any concerns about the safety of your machine or its repairs, have it inspected by a professional electrician or appliance repair technician to ensure that it is in good working condition and safe for use.

Timsort की लॉन्च्यू करें:

```python
import random

from collections import defaultdict

# Create a sorted list of random numbers between 1 and n.
random_numbers = list(range(1, n+1))

# Create a list of permutations of the random numbers.
permutations_of_nums = list(combinations_with_replacement(random_numbers, n))

# Sort the permutations of the random numbers.
permutations_of_nums.sort()

# Create a sorted set from the sorted permutations.
sorted_set_of_permutations_of_nums = defaultdict(list)

# For each permutation of the random numbers, add it to its corresponding sorted set.
for permutation in permutations_of_nums:
    sorted_set_of_permutations_of_nums[permuation].append(permutation)

# Print the sorted set to the screen.
print('Sorted set:')
print(''.join(['%s' for key in sorted_set_of_permutations_of_nums]))
```

There are two main types of research approaches:

1. Descriptive research: The aim of this type of research is to describe or characterize the existing conditions in a particular setting. The researcher typically explores a particular situation and aims to describe the status quo in that context.

2. Causal research: The aim of this type of research is to identify the factors that lead to or influence a particular outcome. The researcher typically attempts to explain the reasons behind an event or phenomenon by identifying causal relationships among variables.

It is important to note that both types of research have their strengths and weaknesses. Descriptive research can provide a comprehensive overview of a particular situation, while causal research can help us understand the underlying mechanisms that may be responsible for that outcome. However, it is important to remember that both types of research are necessary to gain a deeper understanding of the world around us.

मैं एक दोस्त के साथ न्यूजीलैंड में रोडट्रिप कर रहा हूँ और वह मुझे पागल बना रहा है। हमने जितनी भी यात्राएँ की हैं, उन्हें वह आनंद नहीं ले रहा है और किसी चीज़ पर बातचीत करना नहीं चाहता है। हम अपनी यात्रा के एक हफ्ते बाद हैं और यह मेरी जबरदस्ती की कोशिशों के बावजूद सबसे खामोश यात्रा है जब मैं किसी और व्यक्ति के साथ समय बिता रहा हूँ क्योंकि वह मेरी सभी बातचीत की कोशिशों को अस्वीकार कर रहा है। वह अपने एयरपॉड्स कार में और आवास में पहनता है - यह कहने की जरूरत नहीं है कि मैंने उससे बात करने की कोशिशें जारी रखी हैं। सच कहूँ तो, वह सब कुछ को बहुत ही नकारात्मक ऊर्जा के साथ लेकर आ रहा है और यह मेरी यात्रा को बर्बाद कर रहा है।
हमने अभी तक दक्षिणी द्वीप पर कुछ भी बुक नहीं किया है, इसलिए मैं वेलिंगटन में उसे छोड़ने की योजना बना रहा हूँ। शायद पिकटन में अपनी खुद की कार बुक कर लूँ और बाकी यात्रा के लिए अकेले ही आराम करूँ। (बस इसके बारे में सोचने से ही ऐसा तेज राहत मिलता है कि मुझे भावुक हो जाता है। मैं कितनी भी कीमत चुकाने को तैयार हूँ, सिर्फ उससे दूर जाने के लिए।)
स्पष्ट है कि उसे बताना कि वह अपनी नकारात्मक ऊर्जा के कारण मेरी यात्रा को बर्बाद कर रहा है, यह सबसे अच्छा तरीका नहीं है।
क्या आपके पास ऐसा कोई सुझाव है जिससे हम सौहार्दपूर्वक अलग हो सकें? या कम से कम ऐसा कोई वाद-विवाद न हो जिससे बहुत दुखी भावनाएँ हों?### Assistant:

समीक्षा 1: मुझे यकीन नहीं है कि यह केवल इस बात के कारण है कि एड नॉर्टन मुझे इस फिल्म में बहुत परेशान करते हैं, लेकिन मैंने कभी भी फाइट क्लब को किसी प्रकार के सांस्कृतिक महत्व के रूप में स्वीकार नहीं किया। हाँ, यह एक नवाचारी कहानी है, जिसे मजबूत पटकथा, आकर्षक पात्रों और तेजस्वी सिनेमेटोग्राफी के माध्यम से कहा गया है। लेकिन क्या यह वास्तव में इतनी उच्च प्रशंसा के योग्य है? व्यक्तिगत रूप से, मुझे लगता है कि यह आधे से ज्यादा टूटने लगती है और अंत तक काफी उबाऊ हो जाती है। सब कुछ बच्चों की तरह और साज़िशपूर्ण बन जाता है जब कहानी अपने मूल तत्वों से दूर हो जाती है और मशीन के खिलाफ क्रोध की भावना जगह ले लेती है। मुझे इस फिल्म के बनाने के तरीके का विशेष सम्मान है, लेकिन, मैट्रिक्स की तरह, मुझे लगता है कि लोग इस फिल्म को इससे अधिक महत्व देते हैं।
समीक्षा 2: यह फिल्म आज की दुनिया में सामाजिक व्यवस्था के अनुकूल नहीं हो सकने वाले पुरुषों की कहानी कहती है, जो टाइलर डर्डन के नेतृत्व में अपनी प्राकृतिक प्रवृत्ति, पुरुषत्व की खोज और अपने खुशहाल जीवन से बचने की खोज में हैं।
समीक्षा 3: एक अच्छा विषय, शानदार अभिनय और अनौपचारिक तरीके से संदेशों को पहुंचाने वाली इस फिल्म को मेरे ख्याल से दर्शक को कहानी से जोड़ने में असफल होती है और उसे भ्रम की दुनिया में छोड़ देती है। हालांकि, बहुमत समीक्षाओं को इस फिल्म को मनोरंजक और दिलचस्प मानते हैं, फिर भी मैं उस अल्पमत का हिस्सा बनना चुनूंगा जो इस फिल्म को अत्यधिक महत्वाकांक्षी मानता है।
समीक्षा 4: क्या अव्यवस्था, विस्फोट और संगठनवादी संघ के सदस्यता बनाना सामग्री के बंधनों से छुटकारा पाने का तरीका है?! दृश्य प्रभाव आकर्षक हैं और कहानी दूसरे हाफ में रोचक है। दुःख की बात यह है कि यह अच्छी तरह से समाप्त नहीं होती।### Assistant:

Jab tak khoobsurat nahi ho sakti, toh kabhi sochna na paaye
(Khwaab dekhne ke badle uske naam se raha hoon main)

Jab tak bahaane bhi nahi bhare, toh kabhi sochna na paye
(Dil-e-jigar ko chup karne me mere naam se raha hoon main)

Jab tak khwaab bhi khatarnak hoti, toh kabhi paayi jaaye
(Kabhi uski duaon se hi meri khushiyo ke liye raha hoon main)
source: "कंप्यूटर विज्ञान में नौकरी के लिए क्लासिक साक्षात्कार प्रश्नों में सबसे आम विषयों को सोचें।"

तालिका: व्यक्ति
| कॉलम का नाम | प्रकार     |
| personId          | int         |
| lastName         | varchar |
| firstName         | varchar |
personId इस तालिका के लिए प्राथमिक कुंजी कॉलम है।
इस तालिका में कुछ व्यक्तियों के आईडी और उनके पहले और अंतिम नामों के बारे में जानकारी है।
तालिका: पता
| कॉलम का नाम | प्रकार     |
| addressId        | int         |
| personId          | int         |
| city                   | varchar|
| state                | varchar |
addressId इस तालिका के लिए प्राथमिक कुंजी कॉलम है।
इस तालिका की प्रत्येक पंक्ति में ID = PersonId वाले एक व्यक्ति के शहर और राज्य के बारे में जानकारी होती है।
Person तालिका में प्रत्येक व्यक्ति के पहले नाम, अंतिम नाम, शहर और राज्य की रिपोर्ट करने के लिए एक SQL क्वेरी लिखें। यदि Address तालिका में personId का पता नहीं है, तो null की रिपोर्ट करें।
परिणाम तालिका को किसी भी क्रम में वापस करें।

from Person left join Address
on Person.PersonId = Address.PersonId

### Human: आपको दिए गए लेख का संक्षेप में विवरण करें।

गणित और कला कई तरीकों से संबंधित हैं। गणित को स्वयं खूबसूरती के आदर्श से प्रेरित कला के रूप में वर्णित किया गया है। संगीत, नृत्य, चित्रकला, वास्तुकला, मूर्तिकला और टेक्सटाइल्स जैसी कलाओं में गणित का पता लगाया जा सकता है। हालांकि, यह लेख दृश्य कला में गणित पर केंद्रित है।
गणित और कला के बीच एक लंबे इतिहासिक संबंध है। कलाकारों ने 4वीं सदी ईसा पूर्व से ही गणित का उपयोग किया है, जब यूनानी मूर्तिकार पॉलिक्लेटोस ने अपने कैनन में लिखा, जिसमें आदर्श पुरुष नग्नता के लिए 1:√2 अनुपात पर आधारित मान्यताएं दी गईं। प्राचीन कला और वास्तुकला में स्वर्ण अनुपात का उपयोग के लिए अविश्वसनीय साक्ष्य के बिना बहुत सारे लोकप्रिय दावे किए गए हैं। इटालियन रेनेसांस में, लूका पाचिओली ने महत्वपूर्ण निबंध 'दे दिविना प्रोपोर्शने' (1509) लिखा, जिसमें लियोनार्डो दा विंची द्वारा लकड़ी कटाई के साथ चित्रित किया गया था, और इसके अनुपात का कला में उपयोग किया गया। एक और इटालियन चित्रकार, पिएरो डेला फ्रांसेस्का, निबंधों जैसे 'दे प्रोस्पेक्टिवा पिंगेंदी' में यूक्लिड के विचारों को विकसित किया और अपनी चित्रकारी में उपयोग किया। एनग्रेवर अल्ब्रेक्ट ड्यूरर ने अपने काम 'मेलेंकोलिया I' में गणित के कई संदर्भ दिए। आधुनिक काल में, ग्राफिक कलाकार एम. सी. एशर ने गणितीय आकृति और अतिप्रासारिक ज्यामिति का गहन उपयोग किया, गणितज्ञ एच. एस. एम. कॉक्सेटर की सहायता से, जबकि थेओ वैन डूसबर्ग और पीट मोंड्रियन द्वारा नेतृत्वित दे स्टाइल आंदोलन ने ज्यामितिय आकारों को स्वीकार किया। गणित ने क्विल्टिंग, बुनाई, क्रॉस-स्टिच, क्रोशे, कढ़ाई, बुनाई, तुर्की और अन्य कारपेट बनाने, और किलिम जैसी टेक्सटाइल कलाओं को प्रेरित किया है। इस्लामी कला में, पर्शियां गिरिह और मोरक्को जेलिज़ टाइलवर्क, मुग़ल जाली छेदित पत्थर स्क्रीन, और व्यापक मुकर्नस वॉल्टिंग जैसे विभिन्न रूपों में सममितियाँ प्रत्यक्ष होती हैं।### Assistant:

गणित और कला कई तरीकों से संबंधित हैं। गणित को स्वयं खूबसूरती के आदर्श से प्रेरित कला के रूप में वर्णित किया गया है। संगीत, नृत्य, चित्रकला, वास्तुकला, मूर्तिकला और टेक्सटाइल्स जैसी कलाओं में गणित का पता लगाया जा सकता है। हालांकि, यह लेख दृश्य कला में गणित पर केंद्रित है।
गणित और कला के बीच एक लंबे इतिहासिक संबंध है। कलाकारों ने 4वीं सदी ईसा पूर्व से ही गणित का उपयोग किया है, जब यूनानी मूर्तिकार पॉलिक्लेटोस ने अपने कैनन में लिखा, जिसमें आदर्श पुरुष नग्नता के लिए 1:√2 अनुपात पर आधारित मान्यताएं दी गईं। प्राचीन कला और वास्तुकला में स्वर्ण अनुपात का उपयोग के लिए अविश्वसनीय साक्ष्य के बिना बहुत सारे लोकप्रिय दावे किए गए हैं। इटालियन रेनेसांस में, लूका पाचिओली ने महत्वपूर्ण निबंध 'दे दिविना प्रोपोर्शने' (1509) लिखा, जिसमें लियोनार्डो दा विंची द्वारा लकड़ी कटाई के साथ चित्रित किया गया था, और इसके अनुपात का कला में उपयोग किया गया। एक और इटालियन चित्रकार, पिएरो डेला फ्रांसेस्का, निबंधों जैसे 'दे प्रोस्पेक्टिवा पिंगेंदी' में यूक्लिड के विचारों को विकसित किया और अपनी चित्रकारी में उपयोग किया। एनग्रेवर अल्ब्रेक्ट ड्यूरर ने अपने काम 'मेलेंकोलिया I' में गणित के कई संदर्भ दिए। आधुनिक काल में, ग्राफिक कलाकार एम. सी. एशर ने गणितीय आकृति और अतिप्रासारिक ज्यामिति का गहन उपयोग किया, गणितज्ञ एच. एस. एम. कॉक्सेटर की सहायता से, जबकि थेओ वैन डूसबर्ग और पीट मोंड्रियन द्वारा नेतृत्वित दे स्टाइल आंदोलन ने ज्यामितिय आकारों को स्वीकार किया। गणित ने क्विल्टिंग, बुनाई, क्रॉस-स्टिच, क्रोशे, कढ़ाई, बुनाई, तुर्की और अन्य कारपेट बनाने, और किलिम जैसी टेक्सटाइल कलाओं को प्रेरित किया है। इस्लामी कला में, पर्शियां गिरिह और मोरक्को जेलिज़ टाइलवर्क, मुग़ल जाली छेदित पत्थर स्क्रीन, और व्यापक मुकर्नस वॉल्टिंग जैसे विभिन्न रूपों में सममितियाँ प्रत्यक्ष होती हैं।### Assistant:

"लेख की गुणवत्ता का मूल्यांकन किया जाना चाहिए। इसके लिए, आपको लेखन की गुणवत्ता और विषय के स्पष्टीकरण की समीक्षा करनी चाहिए।

20वीं सदी में संगीत सुनने में एक क्रांति देखी गई जब रेडियो वैश्विक रूप से प्रसिद्ध हुआ और संगीत को रिकॉर्ड, संपादित और वितरित करने के लिए नई मीडिया और प्रौद्योगिकियाँ विकसित की गईं। संगीत प्रदर्शनों को बढ़ते हुए दृश्यीकरण के साथ ब्रॉडकास्ट और रिकॉर्डिंग किया गया।
20वीं सदी का संगीत नए स्वतंत्रता और नई संगीतीय शैलियों और रूपों के साथ लाया जो पूर्वकालीन काल के स्वीकृत नियमों को चुनौती देते थे। संगीत के मध्य-20वीं सदी में संगीतीय विस्तार और इलेक्ट्रॉनिक उपकरणों की खोज, विशेष रूप से सिंथेसाइज़र, ने क्लासिकल और लोकप्रिय संगीत को क्रांतिकारी बनाया और नई संगीत के विकास को गति दी।"

इस ट्यूटोरियल का उपयोग करके, आप एक मौजूदा Next.js ऐप में भाषा के AI का उपयोग करके एक उपयोगकर्ता की समीक्षा को सकारात्मक या नकारात्मक रूप में वर्गीकृत कर सकते हैं। हम आपको दिखाते हैं कि आप अपने एप्लिकेशन में भाषा AI का उपयोग कैसे कर सकते हैं। इसे जांचें ↓

source:
कृपया पेपर के अनुरोधित भाग का संक्षेप में व्याख्या दें।

पेपर: प्रमुख अनुक्रम ट्रांसडक्शन मॉडल एनकोडर और डिकोडर समेत जटिल रिकरेंट या कन्वोल्यूशनल न्यूरल नेटवर्क पर आधारित होते हैं। सबसे अच्छा प्रदर्शन करने वाले मॉडल एनकोडर और डिकोडर को एटेंशन मेकेनिज़्म के माध्यम से जोड़ते हैं। हम एक नया सरल नेटवर्क आर्किटेक्चर, ट्रांसफॉर्मर, प्रस्तावित करते हैं, जो केवल एटेंशन मेकेनिज़्म पर आधारित है, और पूरी तरह से रिकरेंस और कन्वोल्यूशन को छोड़ देता है। दो मशीन अनुवाद कार्यों पर प्रयोग से यह साबित होता है कि ये मॉडल गुणवत्ता में बेहतर होते हैं, साथ ही इन्हें पैरललाइज़ करने में अधिक सुविधा होती है और प्रशिक्षण के लिए काफी कम समय की आवश्यकता होती है। हमारा मॉडल WMT 2014 अंग्रेजी-जर्मन अनुवाद कार्य में 28.4 BLEU प्राप्त करता है, जो मौजूदा सर्वोत्कृष्ट परिणामों, संगठनों सहित, से 2 BLEU से अधिक सुधार करता है। WMT 2014 अंग्रेजी-फ्रेंच अनुवाद कार्य में, हमारा मॉडल 3.5 दिनों के प्रशिक्षण के बाद आठ जीपीयू पर 41.8 BLEU स्कोर प्राप्त करता है, जो पुस्तकालय के सर्वोत्कृष्ट मॉडलों के प्रशिक्षण लागत के छोटे हिस्से है। हम दिखाते हैं कि ट्रांसफॉर्मर अन्य कार्यों के लिए भी अच्छी तरह से सामान्यीकृत होता है, जिसे हम इसे बड़े और सीमित प्रशिक्षण डेटा के साथ अंग्रेजी संघटन पार्सिंग में सफलतापूर्वक लागू करके दिखाते हैं।
समझाएँ: प्रमुख अनुक्रम ट्रांसडक्शन मॉडल

अपने अभिप्रेत आधार पर कागज का एक संक्षिप्त, संक्षेप बनाएँ।

फ्यू-शॉट लर्निंग (एफएसएल) मशीन लर्निंग में एक मुख्य भविष्य का कदम है और इसे बहुत ध्यान मिलता है। इस कागज में, हम बातचीत समझ की एफएसएल समस्या पर ध्यान केंद्रित करते हैं, जिसमें दो गहरे संबंधित कार्य होते हैं: इंटेंट पहचान और स्लॉट भरना। बातचीत समझ को साझा सीखने का बहुत फायदा होता है, लेकिन फ्यू-शॉट स्थितियों में ऐसा साझा सीखना चुनौतीपूर्ण हो जाता है: एक ओर, नमूनों की अल्पता दो कार्यों के बीच के संबंध को मॉडलिंग करने की कठिनाई को बहुत बढ़ाती है; दूसरी ओर, कैसे कुछ फ्यू-शॉट स्थिति में कई कार्यों को साझा सीखें यह अभी तक कम जांचा गया है। इसके प्रतिक्रिया के रूप में, हम फ्यूजॉइंट पेश करते हैं, संयुक्त बातचीत समझ के लिए पहला एफएसएल मानचित्र। फ्यूजॉइंट एक नया संवेदी दस्तावेज़ प्रदान करता है जिसमें वास्तविक औद्योगिक एपीआई से 59 विभिन्न बातचीत डोमेन और एफएसएल प्रयोग सेटअप को सुगम बनाने के लिए एक कोड प्लेटफ़ॉर्म शामिल हैं, जिनका उम्मीद है कि इस क्षेत्र के अनुसंधान को आगे बढ़ाएंगे। इसके अलावा, हम यह भी देखते हैं कि फ्यू-शॉट स्थिति की अपर्याप्त प्रदर्शन से अक्सर दो सब-कार्यों के बीच शोर करने और संयुक्त सीखने को बाधित करता है। इस से निपटने के लिए, हम इंटेंट सूचना के साथ स्लॉट को गाइड करते हैं और एक नवीन विश्वास गेटिंग मेकेनिज़म प्रस्तावित करते हैं जो कम आत्मविश्वास वाली इंटेंट सूचना को ब्लॉक करता है ताकि उच्च गुणवत्ता साझा हो सके। इसके अलावा, हम अदृश्य फ्यू-शॉट डोमेन में बेहतर जनरलाइज़ेशन प्राप्त करने के लिए एक रेपटाइल-आधारित मेटा-लर्निंग रणनीति पेश करते हैं। प्रयोगों में, प्रस्तावित विधि दो डेटासेट पर महत्वपूर्ण सुधार लाती है और नई स्टेट-ऑफ-द-आर्ट प्रदर्शन प्राप्त करती है।

Phrase: Phrases are groups of words that have a similar meaning and are grammatically connected in a sentence. For example: a sunny day, the golden rule, the blue sea, the hot sun, the cold wind and the dark night are all phrases.

Syllogism: A syllogism is a form of reasoning that uses three propositions: major premise, minor premise and conclusion. The major premise states that if a is true then b is true; the minor premise states that if b is true then c is true; and the conclusion states that if a and b are both true then c must be true as well. In logic, syllogisms are used to prove or disprove arguments by demonstrating the relationship between the major premise and minor premise and the conclusion using a logical structure known as a valid form of reasoning known as modus ponens or modus tollens depending on whether it is used to prove or disprove an argument respectively.

Assumption: An assumption is a belief or an opinion that is taken for granted without being tested or proven to be true. Assumptions can be made by individuals or groups of people based on their experiences and knowledge of the world around them. Assumptions can be useful in helping us to make decisions and take actions in our daily lives but they can also lead to errors in judgement if we do not carefully consider their validity or relevance to our current situation or circumstances. It is important to be aware of our own assumptions and to be open to challenging them when necessary in order to make more informed decisions and take responsible actions based on sound reasoning rather than simply relying on what we believe or feel about a situation without questioning them critically enough first

- Node.js code is executed on the server, and the resulting output is returned to the client, which is the browser in our case, and it updates the HTML with new code as it is received from the server,
- It runs on an event loop, allowing you to write your code in a way that executes asynchronously and in parallel with other functions that are called by Node,
- It uses non blocking I/O, so it does not block when reading files or writing to sockets or databases, 
- It has modules, so you can define and use your own modules without having to include the entire module body in your code every time you use it, just require it from another file and use it in your code, 
- You can use streams to read files asynchronously, using something like fs.readFileSync to read from a file into a buffer and then write it out using fs.writeFileSync, or you can use streams like fs.readFile to read files synchronously and then write them out asynchronously using fs.writeFileSync,

Panchakarma - 5

Pancha karma literally means “five actions”, and is a set of five Ayurvedic therapeutic procedures or treatments used in traditional Indian medicine. Panchakarma consists of Vamana (emesis), Virechana (purgation), Nasya (nasal administration), Rakta mokshana (bloodletting) and Vasti (medicated enema). These five actions, when performed together, help to remove toxins from the body, improve digestion, balance the mind and emotions, and restore balance and harmony to the body. They are often performed as a series of treatments over a period of several days or weeks.

The five actions are:

1. Vamana: Vamana is a type of emesis therapy in which purgative drugs are administered to induce emesis. This helps to remove excess Kapha and Pitta dosha from the body.

2. Virechana: In this procedure, a medicated purgative is administered through the rectum to remove Kapha and Pitta dosha from the body. This helps to restore balance between the three doshas in the body.

3. Nasya: In this therapy, medicated oil or herbal decoction is administered through the nose to balance the three doshas in the body and improve mental clarity and memory.

4. Rakta mokshana: In this procedure, blood is drawn from the body through a small incision on the scalp or arm and replaced with medicated blood substitutes. This helps to balance the three doshas in the body and improves mental clarity and memory.

5. Vasti: In this therapy, medicated enemas are administered through the rectum to remove excess Kapha and Pitta dosha from the body and improve digestion.

"panchakarma" (5) हो - A set of five actions
source: सरकारें आर्थिक मंदी का सामना करने के लिए वित्तीय और मौद्रिक नीतियों का उपयोग कैसे कर सकती हैं?

The caste system has led to the creation of rigid social hierarchies, where members of different castes are expected to engage in different occupations, marry within their own castes, and engage in other forms of discrimination. This has led to the development of a caste hierarchy, with higher-caste individuals enjoying greater social privileges and lower-caste individuals facing discrimination and violence.

The caste system has had a significant impact on India's social and economic development, as well as its cultural and religious practices. The system has been used to justify social inequality and discrimination, and has contributed to the marginalization of lower-caste individuals. In addition, the caste system has also led to the perpetuation of gender inequalities in India, as women from lower castes are often denied access to education and employment opportunities.

There are many efforts being made to address the issue of caste-based violence and discrimination in India. These include reform of the caste system through constitutional amendments and legislation, as well as efforts to increase awareness about the issue among all levels of society. There are also a number of civil society organizations working on issues related to caste-based violence and discrimination.

Despite these efforts, the issue remains a serious concern for India's future development and social harmony. The caste system continues to have a significant impact on social inequality, gender inequality, and the ability of lower-caste individuals to participate in mainstream Indian society. It is important for India's future development that this issue is addressed effectively, so that all Indians can enjoy their rights and have access to opportunities regardless of their caste or social status.

2) : "Dharma" - This is the word for "duty", and it is the central concept in Hinduism. It can refer to both personal obligations and to the universal principles that govern the universe. The term also carries connotations of righteousness, as well as social order and harmony.

3) : "Brahman" - This is a term used to describe the supreme being in Hinduism, and it can be translated as both "the absolute" and "the unmanifest". It is a concept that encompasses everything in existence, and it is believed to be both transcendent and immanent at the same time.

4) : "Atman" - This is another term used to refer to the soul in Hinduism, and it can also be translated as "soul", "self", or even just as an individual. It is believed to be eternal and unchanging, and it is the source of all human consciousness.

5) : "Dharma Shastra" - This refers to a group of texts that explain how people should behave in order to achieve a harmonious society. These texts are divided into four main categories: Vedas, Smritis, Puranas, and Upanishads. The term was coined by Adi Shankaracharya around the seventh century AD.

6) : "Artha" - This refers to wealth or material possessions. It can also be used to refer to any type of resources that are needed for survival or prosperity in life. The term has two connotations: material wealth as well as spiritual wealth or knowledge.

7) : "Bhagwad Gita"- This is a sacred text in Hinduism that contains teachings of Lord Krishna. It is one of the most important texts in Hinduism, and it provides guidance on how people should live their lives according to Dharma Shastra. The Bhagwad Gita also provides insight into the nature of God, the purpose of life, and how people should conduct themselves in society.

8) : "Nirvana"- This refers to a state of complete detachment from worldly desires and suffering, which is considered an ultimate goal for many Hindus. Nirvana can also be translated as transcendence or cessation. It is sometimes described as a state of mind rather than a physical place or condition.

7. The seventh major division is between cause and effect and correlation vs causation. Cause-effect analysis focuses on identifying the causes of events or phenomena, while correlation vs causation focuses on determining whether two events or phenomena are related but not necessarily caused by each other.
8. The eighth major division is between formal sciences and informal sciences. Formal sciences focus on the structure of phenomena, while informal sciences focus on their application in practice or everyday life. (For example, physics is a formal science, while economics is an informal science.)

The physical sciences focus on the study of matter and energy, while the life sciences focus on living organisms and their interactions with their environments.   In Hinduism agnistotra is a ritualistic sacrifice of fire performed as part of daily worship. It is also known as Homa or Yajna or Aarti in other parts of India. In Vedic times it was done with oblations of ghee on the sacred fire and later with grains and flowers also added to the oblation. The oblation was usually made at sunrise and sunset. In ancient times it was practiced with one's hands folded over each other in a gesture called Namaste and also with the right hand over the left hand with fingers joined at the base of the thumb forming a circle with the thumb on top in a gesture called Pranamasana.

Harishchandra, a noble king of ancient India, was a just and honest ruler who brought peace to his kingdom and people. One day, he was walking along the road when he saw a young woman in distress. She was being attacked by a gang of thugs, and Harishchandra came to her rescue. He fought off the thugs and saved the woman from their clutches. He then took her to his palace and cared for her until she recovered from her injuries. The young woman was grateful for Harishchandra's help and vowed to him that she would do anything to repay him for his kindness.

Harishchandra then asked the young woman what she wanted in return for her help. She replied that she had no family or friends to help her, so she asked if he would marry her. Harishchandra agreed, and the two were married that very day.

The young woman proved to be a loving and devoted wife to Harishchandra. She helped him rule his kingdom with wisdom and compassion, and she raised their children to be good and honest people. The couple was happy together for many years until one day when Harishchandra became ill and died.

The young woman was devastated by the loss of her husband, but she remembered his promise to her and vowed to do everything in her power to honor his memory. She kept his body in the palace for three days so that people could pay their respects, and she took care of his funeral arrangements herself.

The young woman also dedicated herself to the cause of women's education in the kingdom. She visited schools and talked to young girls about the importance of education and how it could improve their lives. She also established a scholarship program for girls who were not able to afford an education.

Over the years, the young woman became known as "Harishchandragupta" or "Hari" for short. She continued to live in the palace and devoted herself to helping women in need until her own death at age 70.

This is a story of love, sacrifice, and commitment that shows how one person can make a difference in the world even if they are just one individual among many. It also shows how even small acts of kindness can have a lasting impact on others.
